At the current adoption rate, Blueskyâ€™s user base is growing by **approximately 1** user per second.

## Website Traffic and App Download Trends: A Reflection of User Growth

## Understanding the Bluesky User Base: Demographics and Geographic Distribution

## Influence and Engagement: Analyzing the Most Followed and Most Blocked Accounts

The distribution of influence on Bluesky Social reveals distinct characteristics of user engagement and platform interactions.

Data from multiple tracking sources, including Bluesky Stats Online, Exploding Topics, and Blue Facts Dev, demonstrates a diverse ecosystem of influential accounts spanning entertainment, politics, and media sectors.

# Bluesky User Age, Gender, & Demographics (2025)

First launched as an independent company in 2021, Bluesky has gained plenty of recent adopters, [seeing rapid growth](https://www.similarweb.com/blog/insights/social-media-news/bluesky-sustained-growth/) in late 2024.

Many former [X users](https://explodingtopics.com/blog/x-user-stats) are [making the switch](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/c8dm0ljg4y6o) from Elon Muskâ€™s platform following increased politicization during the US elections.

Below, weâ€™ll dive into key data related to Blueskyâ€™s user base:

**Contents**

[Bluesky User Data (Top Stats)](https://explodingtopics.com#bluesky-users-top-stats)[Bluesky User Statistics](https://explodingtopics.com#bluesky-user-stats)[Bluesky Users By Age](https://explodingtopics.com#bluesky-users-age)[Bluesky Users By Gender](https://explodingtopics.com#bluesky-users-gender)[Bluesky Users By Region](https://explodingtopics.com#bluesky-users-region)[Bluesky Users By Platform](https://explodingtopics.com#bluesky-users-platform)[Bluesky User Habits](https://explodingtopics.com#bluesky-user-habits)[Most Popular Accounts On Bluesky](https://explodingtopics.com#bluesky-popular-accounts)

### Bluesky User Data (Top Stats)

- There are
**over 33 million**Bluesky users **Approximately 1**user joins Bluesky every second- The Bluesky website gets
[196 million](https://www.semrush.com/analytics/traffic/overview/?q=bsky.app&searchType=domain)[visits per month](https://www.semrush.com/analytics/traffic/overview/?q=bsky.app&searchType=domain) **Around one-third**of Bluesky users are 18 to 24 years old**Over 60%**of Bluesky users are male**Around 2 in 5**Bluesky users are American**Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez**is the most-followed person on Bluesky

### Bluesky User Statistics

In March 2025, the total user count crossed the 33 million mark.

*Pale blue bars are estimated.*

This figure has **almost doubled** in a matter of weeks, growing from **13 million** in late October 2024, and **25 million **in December 2024.

Hereâ€™s how the number of Bluesky users has increased in Q4 2024:

| Date | Number of Bluesky Users |
| October 24, 2024 | 13 million |
| November 13, 2024 | 15 million |
| November 20, 2024 | 20 million |
| December 13, 2024 | 25 million |
| December 18, 2024 | 25.4 million |
| March 11, 2025 | 33 million |

At the current adoption rate, Blueskyâ€™s user base is growing by **approximately 1** user per second.

If that rate were to hold firm, Bluesky would hit** 53 million** users by December 2025. And by December 2026, Bluesky will have surpassed **84 million** users.

The Bluesky website gets [ 196 million visits per month](https://www.semrush.com/analytics/traffic/overview/?q=bsky.app&searchType=domain), of which

**41.3 million**are unique visitors.

Much of Blueskyâ€™s increased popularity has coincided with a downturn in competitor X's daily active users.


X has largely seen daily user numbers decrease as many flock to alternative Bluesky.

That's part of a wider trend of users seeking out "alternative" social platforms. Pixelfed is gaining in popularity as a decentralized Instagram equivalent, while [RedNote](https://explodingtopics.com/blog/rednote-surge) has seen a surge in US users amid the threat of a TikTok ban.

**Sources:** [Jaz](https://bsky.jazco.dev/stats), [TechCrunch](https://www.statista.com/statistics/1536616/global-bluesky-users/), [Theo.io](https://bsky-users.theo.io/), [The Guardian](https://www.theguardian.com/media/2024/dec/11/from-x-to-bluesky-why-are-people-abandoning-twitter-digital-town-square), [VQV](https://vqv.app/stats/)

### Bluesky Users by Age

According to November 2024 data, **around 1 in 3** Bluesky users are aged 18 to 24.

And the majority **(62.64%)** are under 34 years old.

Hereâ€™s a breakdown of Bluesky users by age:

| Age Bracket | Distribution |
| 18 to 24 years | 35.02% |
| 25 to 34 years | 27.67% |
| 35 to 44 years | 14.67% |
| 45 to 54 years | 10.03% |
| 55 to 64 years | 7.74% |
| 65+ years | 4.92% |

**Source:** [SimilarWeb](https://www.similarweb.com/website/bsky.app/#traffic)

### Bluesky Users by Gender

More than half of Bluesky users are male **(62.04%)**.

That figure ranks Bluesky as one of the most male-dominated social media platforms behind Discord **(66.6%) **and Reddit **(63.6%)**.

Hereâ€™s a closer look at the distribution of gender on social media:

### Bluesky Users by Region

According to [Semrush traffic data for Bluesky.com](https://www.semrush.com/website/bluesky.com/overview/), the site had 362,000 visitors in November 2024.

The US has the largest proportion of Bluesky visitors, at **42.27%**.

In fact, Bluesky sees more visitors from the US than the rest of the top five nations combined **(27.91%)**.

Here are the top five countries by Bluesky visitors:

| Rank | Country | Proportion of Bluesky Users | Visit Duration | Pages/Visits | Bounce Rate |

**Source: **[SimilarWeb](https://pro.similarweb.com/#/digitalsuite/websiteanalysis/audience-geography/*/999/1m?key=bsky.app&webSource=Total)

### Bluesky Users by Platform

February 2024 saw by far the most Bluesky downloads for both iOS **(670,722)** and Android **(567,267) **operating systems.

Between February 2023 and March 2024, iOS monthly downloads have outnumbered Android on **12 of 14 **occasions.

However, each of the four most recent recorded months (May to July 2024) saw Android downloads surpass iOS. In fact, during this period, Android amassed almost twice as many downloads as iOS **(473,703 vs 240,132)**.

# Bluesky User Age, Gender, & Demographics (2025)

First launched as an independent company in 2021, Bluesky has gained plenty of recent adopters, [seeing rapid growth](https://www.similarweb.com/blog/insights/social-media-news/bluesky-sustained-growth/) in late 2024.

Many former [X users](https://explodingtopics.com/blog/x-user-stats) are [making the switch](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/c8dm0ljg4y6o) from Elon Musk’s platform following increased politicization during the US elections.

In March 2025, the total user count crossed the 33 million mark.

| November 13, 2024 | 15 million |
| November 20, 2024 | 20 million |
| December 13, 2024 | 25 million |
| December 18, 2024 | 25.4 million |
| March 11, 2025 | 33 million |

At the current adoption rate, Bluesky’s user base is growing by **approximately 1** user per second.

If that rate were to hold firm, Bluesky would hit** 53 million** users by December 2025. And by December 2026, Bluesky will have surpassed **84 million** users.

The Bluesky website gets [ 196 million visits per month](https://www.semrush.com/analytics/traffic/overview/?q=bsky.app&searchType=domain), of which

**41.3 million**are unique visitors.

Much of Bluesky’s increased popularity has coincided with a downturn in competitor X's daily active users.


X has largely seen daily user numbers decrease as many flock to alternative Bluesky.

That's part of a wider trend of users seeking out "alternative" social platforms. Pixelfed is gaining in popularity as a decentralized Instagram equivalent, while [RedNote](https://explodingtopics.com/blog/rednote-surge) has seen a surge in US users amid the threat of a TikTok ban.

# Bluesky Statistics: How Many People Use Bluesky?

Written by [Backlinko Team](https://backlinko.com/blog/authors/backlinko-team)

Publicly launched in February 2024, Bluesky is a microblogging social network, widely considered an alternative to X/Twitter.

During the invite-only stage, Bluesky attracted an audience of 3 million registered users and has since grown to become a popular social media platform with over 27 million users and counting.

Read on to find all the latest Bluesky usage statistics for 2025.

## Key Bluesky Stats

- Bluesky has
**27.44 million**users. - In November 2024, monthly installs of Bluesky app reached
**7.85 million**. - In the US and UK, Bluesky app has around
**3.5 million**daily active users. **20**full-time employees work at Bluesky

## Bluesky Registered Users

According to the latest update, Bluesky currently has **27.44 million** registered users.

Bluesky crossed the milestone of 20 million users in November 2024.

Hereâ€™s a table with number of Bluesky users over time:

| Date | Bluesky Registered Users |
|---|---|
| September 15, 204 | 10 million |
| October 19, 2024 | 12.11 million |
| October 24, 2024 | 13 million |
| November 13, 2024 | 15 million |
| November 20, 2024 | 20 million |
| December 19, 2024 | 25.9 million |
| January 4, 2025 | 26.31 million |
| January 14, 2025 | 27.44 million |

**Sources:** [Bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/jay.bsky.team/post/3lbd2eaura22r), [Jazâ€™s Bsky Stats](https://bsky.jazco.dev/stats), [Statista](https://www.statista.com/statistics/1536616/global-bluesky-users/), [TechCrunch](https://techcrunch.com/2024/09/16/bluesky-now-has-10-million-users/)

## Bluesky Downloads

Monthly downloads of Bluesky on Google Play and App Store combined were **1.76 million** in December 2024.

As of November, annual downloads worldwide of Bluesky in 2024 amounted to 16.52 million.

Hereâ€™s a table with monthly downloads of Bluesky app worldwide across Google Play and App Store combined:

| Date | Bluesky Downloads |
|---|---|
| February 2023 | 0.02 million |
| March 2023 | 0.09 million |
| April 2023 | 0.58 million |
| May 2023 | 0.25 million |
| June 2023 | 0.09 million |
| July 2023 | 0.62 million |
| August 2023 | 0.32 million |
| September 2023 | 0.47 million |
| October 2023 | 0.63 million |
| November 2023 | 0.41 million |
| December 2023 | 0.51 million |
| January 2024 | 0.18 million |
| February 2024 | 1.25 million |
| March 2024 | 0.16 million |
| April 2024 | 0.26 million |
| May 2024 | 0.08 million |
| June 2024 | 0.3 million |
| July 2024 | 0.07 million |
| August 2024 | 0.76 million |
| September 2024 | 2.85 million |
| October 2024 | 2.76 million |
| November 2024 | 7.85 million |
| December 2024 | 1.76 million |

**Source:** [Statista](https://www.statista.com/statistics/1399030/global-bluesky-installs/), [Appfigures](https://appfigures.com/)

## Bluesky App Daily Active Users

According to recent data, Bluesky app has **3.5 million** daily active users in the US and UK.

**Source:** [Financial Times](https://www.ft.com/content/e1b52147-c171-4902-8bce-204ba0905912)

## Bluesky Website Monthly Visits

According to latest data, visits to Bluesky website reached **154.68 million** in December 2024, showing a 93% increase since October 2024.

Hereâ€™s a detailed breakdown of Bluesky website visits:

| Date | Bluesky Website Visits |
|---|---|
| June 2024 | 17.41 million |
| July 2024 | 16.48 million |
| August 2024 | 21 million |
| September 2024 | 67.09 million |
| October 2024 | 80.16 million |
| November 2024 | 157.04 million |
| December 2024 | 154.68 million |

**Source:** [Semrush](https://www.semrush.com/website/bsky.app/overview/?utm_campaign=bluesky-statistics&utm_source=backlinko.com&utm_medium=referral)

## Bluesky Website Traffic by Country

In December 2024, the United States accounted for over half (**55.7%**) of website traffic to Bluesky website, followed by the UK (6.97%), Japan (6.75%), Canada (3.05%) and Brazil (3.01%).

**Source:** [Semrush](https://www.semrush.com/website/bsky.app/overview/?utm_campaign=bluesky-statistics&utm_source=backlinko.com&utm_medium=referral)

## Bluesky Users by Country

According to Bluesky CEO (Jay Graber), the countries with the highest number of Bluesky users are the United States, Japan, and Brazil.

**Source:** [Bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/jay.bsky.team/post/3lbd2eeh2hf2r)

## Bluesky Funding

Bluesky raised **$23 million** across 2 rounds to date, including its latest $15 million Series A funding round announced in October 2024.

Hereâ€™s a breakdown of all funding rounds of Bluesky:

| Date | Funding Amount, Round |
|---|---|
| July 2023 | $8 million, Seed |
| October 2024 | $15 million, Series A |

**Source:** [TechCrunch](https://techcrunch.com/2024/10/24/bluesky-raises-15m-series-a-plans-to-launch-subscriptions/)

## How Many Employees Work at Bluesky?

Bluesky has **20 full-time employees and 100 contractors** who work as content moderators. Bluesky operates with a fully remote team.

At the time of writing, Bluesky had 2 publicly available job postings on its website.

**Source:** [Bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/jay.bsky.team/post/3lbd2ee2pwc2r), [Platformer](https://www.platformer.news/bluesky-growth-content-moderation-trust-safety-interview/)

## Conclusion

Thatâ€™s it for my list of Bluesky user stats.

Bluesky is currently one of the fastest-growing social networks but as a private company they donâ€™t disclose many details. So I did my best to find recent data from multiple sources to bring you the latest stats on one page.

In the rapidly evolving social media environment, Bluesky Social has emerged as a compelling case study in exponential platform development. Recent data from Backlinko reveals a remarkable surge in user adoption, with the platformâ€™s user base expanding from 10 million in September 2024 to 27.44 million by mid-January 2025.

The platformâ€™s distinctive decentralized architecture has attracted a demographically diverse audience, though SimilarWeb data indicates a clear skew toward younger users, with over 62% of participants under age 35. This youth-driven momentum has contributed to unprecedented engagement metrics, including 154.68 million website visits in December 2024 alone, according to Semrush analytics.

What makes Blueskyâ€™s trajectory particularly noteworthy is its sustained growth rate of approximately 0.5 users per second, as reported by Exploding Topics. This acceleration has caught the attention of influential figures across entertainment, politics, and media, with personalities like Mark Cuban and Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez amassing followings exceeding 1 million users each.

Behind these numbers lies a lean operational model that challenges traditional social media infrastructure. With just 20 full-time employees supported by 100 contractors, Bluesky has secured $23 million in funding while maintaining a fully remote workforce â€“ suggesting a new blueprint for scaling social platforms in the post-pandemic era.

## Bluesky Socialâ€™s Explosive User Growth in Late 2024 and Early 2025

Backlinkoâ€™s thorough tracking reveals an unprecedented growth trajectory for Bluesky Social between September 2024 and January 2025. The platformâ€™s user base expanded by 174.4% in just four months, demonstrating one of the fastest adoption rates among emerging social networks in recent years.

### Documenting the Surge: User Numbers from September 2024 to January 2025

The platformâ€™s growth curve shows distinct acceleration phases throughout late 2024. Starting from 10 million users on September 15, Bluesky doubled its user base to 20 million by November 20, representing an average daily gain of 166,667 new users during this period.

The momentum continued through December 19, when the platform reached 25.9 million users, before climbing to 27.44 million by January 14, 2025.

#### Quantifying the Growth Rate: 0.5 Users Per Second

Exploding Topicsâ€™ analysis indicates a consistent growth rate of approximately 0.5 users per second throughout this period. This translates to 43,200 new users daily, suggesting robust platform scalability despite the rapid expansion.

The sustained growth rate particularly stands out during the September-December surge, when the platform maintained stable performance while processing an average of 1,800 new user registrations per hour.

### Projecting the Future: 30 Million Users by April 2025

Based on current growth patterns, Exploding Topics projects Bluesky Social will reach 30 million users by April 2025. This forecast accounts for the platformâ€™s demonstrated ability to maintain a steady growth rate of 0.5 users per second, even during periods of intense scaling.

The projection appears conservative when compared to the platformâ€™s historical performance, considering it added 15.9 million users in the 95 days between September and December 2024, averaging 167,368 new users daily during peak growth phases.

## Website Traffic and App Download Trends: A Reflection of User Growth

Semrush analytics reveals a striking correlation between Bluesky Socialâ€™s website traffic and its exponential user growth in late 2024.

The platformâ€™s digital footprint expanded dramatically, with website visits increasing nearly ninefold between June and December 2024, while app installations reached record levels during the same period.

### Website Traffic Analysis: 154.68 Million Visits in December 2024

Semrush data documents an extraordinary surge in website traffic, with monthly visits climbing from 17.41 million in June 2024 to 154.68 million by December 2024. This 888% increase over six months represents one of the steepest growth curves observed in social media platforms during 2024.

The December peak coincided with the platformâ€™s rapid user acquisition phase, when Bluesky was adding approximately 43,200 new users daily.

### App Download Surge: 7.85 Million Downloads in November 2024

According to Statista and Appfigures analytics, Blueskyâ€™s mobile presence reached its zenith in November 2024, recording 7.85 million app downloads across both major mobile platforms.

This peak contributed significantly to the platformâ€™s total 2024 installation base of 16.52 million downloads through November. The timing of this surge aligned precisely with the platformâ€™s acceleration to 20 million users by November 20, 2024, as reported by Backlinko.

### Platform Preference: Android vs. iOS Downloads

A notable shift occurred between May and July 2024, when Android installations surpassed iOS downloads for the first time, according to Statista data.

This transition reflects Blueskyâ€™s expanding global reach, particularly in markets where Android devices dominate mobile usage.

The platform preference data correlates strongly with Blueskyâ€™s geographic distribution patterns, showing significant user growth in Android-heavy markets such as Brazil, where the platform captured 11.01% of its total user base.

## Understanding the Bluesky User Base: Demographics and Geographic Distribution

SimilarWebâ€™s thorough demographic analysis reveals distinct patterns in Bluesky Socialâ€™s user composition, painting a picture of a platform that particularly resonates with younger, tech-savvy audiences.

The data shows clear demographic concentrations that distinguish Bluesky from more established social networks.

### Age Demographics: A Young User Base

SimilarWeb data indicates a strong youth skew in Blueskyâ€™s user demographics, with 35.02% of users falling within the 18-24 age bracket. The platformâ€™s appeal to young adults extends further, as an additional 27.67% of users are aged 25-34.

This concentration of users under 35 (62.69%) suggests the platform has successfully tapped into digital nativesâ€™ preferences for decentralized social networking.

### Gender Breakdown: Male Dominance on the Platform

The platform exhibits a notable gender disparity, with SimilarWeb reporting that 62.04% of users identify as male, compared to 37.96% female.

This male-skewed ratio aligns with early adoption patterns typically seen in technology-focused platforms, particularly those emphasizing decentralized architecture and technical innovation.

### Geographic Analysis: The United States Leads, Followed by Brazil and the UK

Geographic distribution data reveals varying levels of market penetration across regions. Semrush analytics shows the United States leading with 55.7% of users, though SimilarWeb reports a more modest 42.27%.

Brazil has emerged as a significant market, capturing 11.01% of users, while the UK maintains a solid presence with 7.51% according to SimilarWeb (6.97% per Semrush). Japan follows with approximately 6.75% (Semrush), while Germany and Canada round out the top markets with 3.21% and 3.05% respectively.

### Daily Active Users in the US and UK

The Financial Times, as reported by Backlinko, identifies 3.5 million daily active users across the US and UK markets combined.

This engagement metric represents approximately 12.8% of Blueskyâ€™s total user base converting to daily active users in these key markets, suggesting strong user retention and engagement patterns in English-speaking regions.

## Influence and Engagement: Analyzing the Most Followed and Most Blocked Accounts

The distribution of influence on Bluesky Social reveals distinct characteristics of user engagement and platform interactions.

Data from multiple tracking sources, including Bluesky Stats Online, Exploding Topics, and Blue Facts Dev, demonstrates a diverse ecosystem of influential accounts spanning entertainment, politics, and media sectors.

### Top Followed Accounts: Celebrities, Political Figures, and Media Organizations

Analysis of follower metrics shows significant variation across different tracking platforms. Blue Facts Dev data indicates strong performance among political figures, with Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez maintaining 1,731,865 followers, while Bluesky Stats Online reports entrepreneur Mark Cuban leading individual accounts with 1,250,242 followers.

The entertainment sector shows substantial influence, with George Takei and Mark Hamill each commanding over 1 million followers according to Blue Facts Dev (1,152,594 and 1,119,493 respectively).

#### The Official Bluesky Account: An Outlier in Follower Count

The platformâ€™s official account demonstrates unprecedented reach, with Blue Facts Dev reporting 22,731,569 followers â€“ nearly 13 times the following of the next most popular account. This significant disparity between the official account and individual influencers suggests a centralized communication model, where platform updates and announcements reach approximately 82.8% of the total user base.

### Most Blocked Users: A Diverse Range of Profiles

VQV Appâ€™s block tracking reveals complex community moderation patterns across the platform. The blocked user database spans multiple categories, including content creators, journalists, political commentators, and automated accounts, indicating diverse triggers for user blocking behavior.

#### High Block Counts: Tens of Thousands of Blocks for Some Accounts

Block metrics from VQV App show concentrated blocking activity, with the highest counts reaching 27,074 blocks for @eisinceraa.bsky.social and 24,019 for @dril.bsky.social.

These numbers represent significant community response, with the most-blocked accounts facing rejection from approximately 0.1% of the platformâ€™s total user base.

The pattern suggests active community moderation through individual blocking decisions rather than centralized content restriction.

## Behind the Scenes: Blueskyâ€™s Company Structure, Funding, and Operations

Backlinkoâ€™s analysis, drawing from TechCrunch, Bluesky, and Platformer reports, reveals Blueskyâ€™s distinctive operational approach. The platform maintains remarkable efficiency with a lean organizational structure, having scaled to serve over 27 million users while operating with just 120 total team members.

### Team Structure: 20 Full-Time Employees and 100 Contractors

The platform operates with a primary team of 20 full-time employees, supplemented by 100 contractors primarily focused on content moderation. This 1:5 ratio of employees to contractors represents an innovative approach to scalability, allowing the platform to maintain agility while managing rapid user growth.

The model demonstrates particular efficiency in cost management, with each full-time employee effectively supporting approximately 1.37 million users.

### Funding Rounds: $23 Million Secured

Blueskyâ€™s funding history shows strategic capital deployment across two major rounds. The initial $8 million Seed round in July 2023 established foundational infrastructure, while the subsequent $15 million Series A in October 2024 coincided with the platformâ€™s exponential growth phase.

This funding trajectory translates to approximately $0.84 per user based on January 2025â€™s user count, suggesting efficient capital utilization compared to industry standards.

### Remote Work Model: A Fully Distributed Team

The platformâ€™s fully remote operational model, documented by TechCrunch and verified by Platformer, demonstrates the viability of distributed teams in social media platform management.

This approach has enabled Bluesky to tap into global talent pools while maintaining operational costs at approximately 5% of its total funding, according to industry analysts. The remote structure particularly benefits the content moderation team, enabling 24/7 coverage across multiple time zones with the 100-person contractor workforce.

## Frequently Asked Questions

#### How many people use Bluesky daily compared to monthly?

According to the Financial Times via Backlinko, Bluesky records 3.5 million daily active users in the US and UK combined as of early 2025. This represents approximately 12.8% of the platformâ€™s total monthly user base, which reached 27.44 million globally by January 14, 2025.

#### What is the most popular age group on Bluesky?

SimilarWeb data reveals that Gen Z and younger millennials dominate the platform, with 18-24 year-olds comprising 35.02% of users, followed by 25-34 year-olds at 27.67%.

This concentration of younger users indicates strong appeal among digital natives.

#### What are the top 5 countries with the most Bluesky users?

Geographic distribution data shows varying percentages across sources.

The United States leads with 42.27-55.7% of users (SimilarWeb/Semrush), followed by Brazil (11.01%), the UK (6.97-7.51%), Japan (6.18-6.75%), and Germany (3.21%). Canada maintains a notable presence with 3.05% of users.

#### Who are the top 5 most followed accounts on Bluesky?

The platformâ€™s official account leads by a significant margin with 18-22.7 million followers (Exploding Topics/Blue Facts Dev).

Among individual users, Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez commands 1.18-1.73 million followers, followed by Mark Cuban (1.25 million), George Takei (0.93-1.15 million), and Mark Hamill (0.9-1.12 million).

#### Who are the top 5 most blocked accounts on Bluesky?

VQV App tracking reveals diverse profiles among frequently blocked accounts, with @eisinceraa.bsky.social leading at 27,074 blocks, followed by @dril.bsky.social at 24,019 blocks.

The blocked accounts span content creators, political figures, journalists, and automated accounts.

#### How much funding has Bluesky received, and what are their primary funding sources?

Bluesky has secured $23 million in total funding through two rounds: an $8 million Seed round in July 2023 and a $15 million Series A round in October 2024, as reported by TechCrunch, Bluesky, and Platformer via Backlinko.

Exploding Topics data shows Bluesky consistently adding approximately 0.5 users per second. The platform demonstrated remarkable momentum by more than doubling its user base from 10 million to 25.9 million between September and December 2024, representing one of the fastest growth rates among emerging social platforms.

## Conclusion

Bluesky Socialâ€™s meteoric rise in late 2024 demonstrates remarkable platform growth, with user numbers surging from 10 million in September 2024 to 27.44 million by January 2025, as documented by Backlinko. This 174.4% increase occurred alongside substantial engagement metrics, including 154.68 million monthly website visits and 7.85 million app downloads at their respective peaks.

The platformâ€™s demographic composition reveals distinct patterns: SimilarWeb data shows 62.69% of users are under 35, with Gen Z (18-24) representing the largest cohort at 35.02%. The gender distribution skews male at 62.04%, while geographic data indicates strong U.S. dominance, though with notable variances between sources (42.27-55.7% of total users).

Blueskyâ€™s operational model presents an intriguing case study in lean platform management. The company maintains efficiency with just 20 full-time employees and 100 contractors, while securing $23 million in funding across two rounds. This structure yields an impressive ratio of approximately 1.37 million users per full-time employee.

These metrics paint a picture of rapid growth and efficient scaling, though several challenges merit attention. Content moderation demands are evidenced by high block counts reaching 27,074 for single accounts, while data discrepancies between tracking sources suggest the need for standardized measurement protocols.

Future research should address current limitations in engagement metrics and demographic data to better understand user behavior patterns and platform sustainability.

As Bluesky approaches its projected 30 million users by April 2025, its trajectory indicates potential for significant market impact, provided it can maintain its growth momentum while addressing these operational challenges.

The entertainment sector shows substantial influence, with George Takei and Mark Hamill each commanding over 1 million followers according to Blue Facts Dev (1,152,594 and 1,119,493 respectively).

#### The Official Bluesky Account: An Outlier in Follower Count

The platform’s official account demonstrates unprecedented reach, with Blue Facts Dev reporting 22,731,569 followers – nearly 13 times the following of the next most popular account. This significant disparity between the official account and individual influencers suggests a centralized communication model, where platform updates and announcements reach approximately 82.8% of the total user base.

### Most Blocked Users: A Diverse Range of Profiles

VQV App’s block tracking reveals complex community moderation patterns across the platform. The blocked user database spans multiple categories, including content creators, journalists, political commentators, and automated accounts, indicating diverse triggers for user blocking behavior.

#### High Block Counts: Tens of Thousands of Blocks for Some Accounts

Block metrics from VQV App show concentrated blocking activity, with the highest counts reaching 27,074 blocks for @eisinceraa.bsky.social and 24,019 for @dril.bsky.social.

These numbers represent significant community response, with the most-blocked accounts facing rejection from approximately 0.1% of the platform’s total user base.

The pattern suggests active community moderation through individual blocking decisions rather than centralized content restriction.

## Behind the Scenes: Bluesky’s Company Structure, Funding, and Operations

Backlinko’s analysis, drawing from TechCrunch, Bluesky, and Platformer reports, reveals Bluesky’s distinctive operational approach. The platform maintains remarkable efficiency with a lean organizational structure, having scaled to serve over 27 million users while operating with just 120 total team members.

### Team Structure: 20 Full-Time Employees and 100 Contractors

The platform operates with a primary team of 20 full-time employees, supplemented by 100 contractors primarily focused on content moderation. This 1:5 ratio of employees to contractors represents an innovative approach to scalability, allowing the platform to maintain agility while managing rapid user growth.

The model demonstrates particular efficiency in cost management, with each full-time employee effectively supporting approximately 1.37 million users.

### Funding Rounds: $23 Million Secured

Bluesky’s funding history shows strategic capital deployment across two major rounds. The initial $8 million Seed round in July 2023 established foundational infrastructure, while the subsequent $15 million Series A in October 2024 coincided with the platform’s exponential growth phase.

This funding trajectory translates to approximately $0.84 per user based on January 2025’s user count, suggesting efficient capital utilization compared to industry standards.

### Remote Work Model: A Fully Distributed Team

The platform’s fully remote operational model, documented by TechCrunch and verified by Platformer, demonstrates the viability of distributed teams in social media platform management.

This approach has enabled Bluesky to tap into global talent pools while maintaining operational costs at approximately 5% of its total funding, according to industry analysts. The remote structure particularly benefits the content moderation team, enabling 24/7 coverage across multiple time zones with the 100-person contractor workforce.

## Frequently Asked Questions

#### How many people use Bluesky daily compared to monthly?

According to the Financial Times via Backlinko, Bluesky records 3.5 million daily active users in the US and UK combined as of early 2025. This represents approximately 12.8% of the platform’s total monthly user base, which reached 27.44 million globally by January 14, 2025.

#### What is the most popular age group on Bluesky?

SimilarWeb data reveals that Gen Z and younger millennials dominate the platform, with 18-24 year-olds comprising 35.02% of users, followed by 25-34 year-olds at 27.67%.

This concentration of younger users indicates strong appeal among digital natives.

#### What are the top 5 countries with the most Bluesky users?

Geographic distribution data shows varying percentages across sources.

The United States leads with 42.27-55.7% of users (SimilarWeb/Semrush), followed by Brazil (11.01%), the UK (6.97-7.51%), Japan (6.18-6.75%), and Germany (3.21%). Canada maintains a notable presence with 3.05% of users.

#### Who are the top 5 most followed accounts on Bluesky?

The platform’s official account leads by a significant margin with 18-22.7 million followers (Exploding Topics/Blue Facts Dev).

Among individual users, Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez commands 1.18-1.73 million followers, followed by Mark Cuban (1.25 million), George Takei (0.93-1.15 million), and Mark Hamill (0.9-1.12 million).

#### Who are the top 5 most blocked accounts on Bluesky?

VQV App tracking reveals diverse profiles among frequently blocked accounts, with @eisinceraa.bsky.social leading at 27,074 blocks, followed by @dril.bsky.social at 24,019 blocks.

The blocked accounts span content creators, political figures, journalists, and automated accounts.

#### How much funding has Bluesky received, and what are their primary funding sources?

Bluesky has secured $23 million in total funding through two rounds: an $8 million Seed round in July 2023 and a $15 million Series A round in October 2024, as reported by TechCrunch, Bluesky, and Platformer via Backlinko.

Exploding Topics data shows Bluesky consistently adding approximately 0.5 users per second. The platform demonstrated remarkable momentum by more than doubling its user base from 10 million to 25.9 million between September and December 2024, representing one of the fastest growth rates among emerging social platforms.

## Conclusion

Bluesky Social’s meteoric rise in late 2024 demonstrates remarkable platform growth, with user numbers surging from 10 million in September 2024 to 27.44 million by January 2025, as documented by Backlinko. This 174.4% increase occurred alongside substantial engagement metrics, including 154.68 million monthly website visits and 7.85 million app downloads at their respective peaks.

The platform’s demographic composition reveals distinct patterns: SimilarWeb data shows 62.69% of users are under 35, with Gen Z (18-24) representing the largest cohort at 35.02%. The gender distribution skews male at 62.04%, while geographic data indicates strong U.S. dominance, though with notable variances between sources (42.27-55.7% of total users).

Bluesky’s operational model presents an intriguing case study in lean platform management. The company maintains efficiency with just 20 full-time employees and 100 contractors, while securing $23 million in funding across two rounds. This structure yields an impressive ratio of approximately 1.37 million users per full-time employee.

These metrics paint a picture of rapid growth and efficient scaling, though several challenges merit attention. Content moderation demands are evidenced by high block counts reaching 27,074 for single accounts, while data discrepancies between tracking sources suggest the need for standardized measurement protocols.

Future research should address current limitations in engagement metrics and demographic data to better understand user behavior patterns and platform sustainability.

As Bluesky approaches its projected 30 million users by April 2025, its trajectory indicates potential for significant market impact, provided it can maintain its growth momentum while addressing these operational challenges.

# Bluesky User Age, Gender, & Demographics (2025)

First launched as an independent company in 2021, Bluesky has gained plenty of recent adopters, [seeing rapid growth](https://www.similarweb.com/blog/insights/social-media-news/bluesky-sustained-growth/) in late 2024.

Many former [X users](https://explodingtopics.com/blog/x-user-stats) are [making the switch](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/c8dm0ljg4y6o) from Elon Musk’s platform following increased politicization during the US elections.

Below, we’ll dive into key data related to Bluesky’s user base:

**Contents**

[Bluesky User Data (Top Stats)](https://explodingtopics.com#bluesky-users-top-stats)[Bluesky User Statistics](https://explodingtopics.com#bluesky-user-stats)[Bluesky Users By Age](https://explodingtopics.com#bluesky-users-age)[Bluesky Users By Gender](https://explodingtopics.com#bluesky-users-gender)[Bluesky Users By Region](https://explodingtopics.com#bluesky-users-region)[Bluesky Users By Platform](https://explodingtopics.com#bluesky-users-platform)[Bluesky User Habits](https://explodingtopics.com#bluesky-user-habits)[Most Popular Accounts On Bluesky](https://explodingtopics.com#bluesky-popular-accounts)

### Bluesky User Data (Top Stats)

- There are
**over 33 million**Bluesky users **Approximately 1**user joins Bluesky every second- The Bluesky website gets
[196 million](https://www.semrush.com/analytics/traffic/overview/?q=bsky.app&searchType=domain)[visits per month](https://www.semrush.com/analytics/traffic/overview/?q=bsky.app&searchType=domain) **Around one-third**of Bluesky users are 18 to 24 years old**Over 60%**of Bluesky users are male**Around 2 in 5**Bluesky users are American**Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez**is the most-followed person on Bluesky

### Bluesky User Statistics

In March 2025, the total user count crossed the 33 million mark.

*Pale blue bars are estimated.*

This figure has **almost doubled** in a matter of weeks, growing from **13 million** in late October 2024, and **25 million **in December 2024.

Here’s how the number of Bluesky users has increased in Q4 2024:

| Date | Number of Bluesky Users |
| October 24, 2024 | 13 million |
| November 13, 2024 | 15 million |
| November 20, 2024 | 20 million |
| December 13, 2024 | 25 million |
| December 18, 2024 | 25.4 million |
| March 11, 2025 | 33 million |

At the current adoption rate, Bluesky’s user base is growing by **approximately 1** user per second.

If that rate were to hold firm, Bluesky would hit** 53 million** users by December 2025. And by December 2026, Bluesky will have surpassed **84 million** users.

The Bluesky website gets [ 196 million visits per month](https://www.semrush.com/analytics/traffic/overview/?q=bsky.app&searchType=domain), of which

**41.3 million**are unique visitors.

Much of Bluesky’s increased popularity has coincided with a downturn in competitor X's daily active users.


X has largely seen daily user numbers decrease as many flock to alternative Bluesky.

That's part of a wider trend of users seeking out "alternative" social platforms. Pixelfed is gaining in popularity as a decentralized Instagram equivalent, while [RedNote](https://explodingtopics.com/blog/rednote-surge) has seen a surge in US users amid the threat of a TikTok ban.

### Bluesky Users by Age

According to November 2024 data, **around 1 in 3** Bluesky users are aged 18 to 24.

And the majority **(62.64%)** are under 34 years old.

Here’s a breakdown of Bluesky users by age:

| Age Bracket | Distribution |
| 18 to 24 years | 35.02% |
| 25 to 34 years | 27.67% |
| 35 to 44 years | 14.67% |
| 45 to 54 years | 10.03% |
| 55 to 64 years | 7.74% |
| 65+ years | 4.92% |

**Source:** [SimilarWeb](https://www.similarweb.com/website/bsky.app/#traffic)

### Bluesky Users by Gender

More than half of Bluesky users are male **(62.04%)**.

That figure ranks Bluesky as one of the most male-dominated social media platforms behind Discord **(66.6%) **and Reddit **(63.6%)**.

Here’s a closer look at the distribution of gender on social media:

### Bluesky Users by Region

According to [Semrush traffic data for Bluesky.com](https://www.semrush.com/website/bluesky.com/overview/), the site had 362,000 visitors in November 2024.

The US has the largest proportion of Bluesky visitors, at **42.27%**.

In fact, Bluesky sees more visitors from the US than the rest of the top five nations combined **(27.91%)**.

### Bluesky Users by Platform

February 2024 saw by far the most Bluesky downloads for both iOS **(670,722)** and Android **(567,267) **operating systems.

Between February 2023 and March 2024, iOS monthly downloads have outnumbered Android on **12 of 14 **occasions.

However, each of the four most recent recorded months (May to July 2024) saw Android downloads surpass iOS. In fact, during this period, Android amassed almost twice as many downloads as iOS **(473,703 vs 240,132)**.

### Bluesky User Habits

**Around** **1.18 million** posts have been made on Bluesky as of March 2025. That equates to **35 **posts per user.

Based on November 2024 data, the average Bluesky visit lasts **10 minutes and 35 seconds**. That’s just under the X average of **12 minutes and 1 second **per visit.

Here’s a comparison between average visit durations for selected social media platforms:

| Platform | Average Visit Duration |

On average, each Bluesky user visits **approximately** **8** pages per session.

By comparison, X users visit around 50% more pages (**approximately 12** per session).

It’s clear that Bluesky has caught the attention of millions. And with many becoming disillusioned with X as a social platform, the number of Bluesky users looks set to continue to grow.

# Bluesky Statistics: How Many People Use Bluesky?

Written by [Backlinko Team](https://backlinko.com/blog/authors/backlinko-team)

Publicly launched in February 2024, Bluesky is a microblogging social network, widely considered an alternative to X/Twitter.

During the invite-only stage, Bluesky attracted an audience of 3 million registered users and has since grown to become a popular social media platform with over 27 million users and counting.

Read on to find all the latest Bluesky usage statistics for 2025.

## Key Bluesky Stats

- Bluesky has
**27.44 million**users. - In November 2024, monthly installs of Bluesky app reached
**7.85 million**. - In the US and UK, Bluesky app has around
**3.5 million**daily active users. **20**full-time employees work at Bluesky

## Bluesky Registered Users

According to the latest update, Bluesky currently has **27.44 million** registered users.

Bluesky crossed the milestone of 20 million users in November 2024.

Here’s a table with number of Bluesky users over time:

| Date | Bluesky Registered Users |
|---|---|
| September 15, 204 | 10 million |
| October 19, 2024 | 12.11 million |
| October 24, 2024 | 13 million |
| November 13, 2024 | 15 million |
| November 20, 2024 | 20 million |
| December 19, 2024 | 25.9 million |
| January 4, 2025 | 26.31 million |
| January 14, 2025 | 27.44 million |

**Sources:** [Bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/jay.bsky.team/post/3lbd2eaura22r), [Jaz’s Bsky Stats](https://bsky.jazco.dev/stats), [Statista](https://www.statista.com/statistics/1536616/global-bluesky-users/), [TechCrunch](https://techcrunch.com/2024/09/16/bluesky-now-has-10-million-users/)

## Bluesky Downloads

Monthly downloads of Bluesky on Google Play and App Store combined were **1.76 million** in December 2024.

As of November, annual downloads worldwide of Bluesky in 2024 amounted to 16.52 million.

Here’s a table with monthly downloads of Bluesky app worldwide across Google Play and App Store combined:

| Date | Bluesky Downloads |
|---|---|
| February 2023 | 0.02 million |
| March 2023 | 0.09 million |
| April 2023 | 0.58 million |
| May 2023 | 0.25 million |
| June 2023 | 0.09 million |
| July 2023 | 0.62 million |
| August 2023 | 0.32 million |
| September 2023 | 0.47 million |
| October 2023 | 0.63 million |
| November 2023 | 0.41 million |
| December 2023 | 0.51 million |
| January 2024 | 0.18 million |
| February 2024 | 1.25 million |
| March 2024 | 0.16 million |
| April 2024 | 0.26 million |
| May 2024 | 0.08 million |
| June 2024 | 0.3 million |
| July 2024 | 0.07 million |
| August 2024 | 0.76 million |
| September 2024 | 2.85 million |
| October 2024 | 2.76 million |
| November 2024 | 7.85 million |
| December 2024 | 1.76 million |

**Source:** [Statista](https://www.statista.com/statistics/1399030/global-bluesky-installs/), [Appfigures](https://appfigures.com/)

## Bluesky App Daily Active Users

According to recent data, Bluesky app has **3.5 million** daily active users in the US and UK.

**Source:** [Financial Times](https://www.ft.com/content/e1b52147-c171-4902-8bce-204ba0905912)

## Bluesky Website Monthly Visits

According to latest data, visits to Bluesky website reached **154.68 million** in December 2024, showing a 93% increase since October 2024.

Here’s a detailed breakdown of Bluesky website visits:

| Date | Bluesky Website Visits |
|---|---|
| June 2024 | 17.41 million |
| July 2024 | 16.48 million |
| August 2024 | 21 million |
| September 2024 | 67.09 million |
| October 2024 | 80.16 million |
| November 2024 | 157.04 million |
| December 2024 | 154.68 million |

**Source:** [Semrush](https://www.semrush.com/website/bsky.app/overview/?utm_campaign=bluesky-statistics&utm_source=backlinko.com&utm_medium=referral)

## Bluesky Website Traffic by Country

In December 2024, the United States accounted for over half (**55.7%**) of website traffic to Bluesky website, followed by the UK (6.97%), Japan (6.75%), Canada (3.05%) and Brazil (3.01%).

**Source:** [Semrush](https://www.semrush.com/website/bsky.app/overview/?utm_campaign=bluesky-statistics&utm_source=backlinko.com&utm_medium=referral)

## Bluesky Users by Country

According to Bluesky CEO (Jay Graber), the countries with the highest number of Bluesky users are the United States, Japan, and Brazil.

**Source:** [Bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/jay.bsky.team/post/3lbd2eeh2hf2r)

## Bluesky Funding

Bluesky raised **$23 million** across 2 rounds to date, including its latest $15 million Series A funding round announced in October 2024.

Here’s a breakdown of all funding rounds of Bluesky:

| Date | Funding Amount, Round |
|---|---|
| July 2023 | $8 million, Seed |
| October 2024 | $15 million, Series A |

**Source:** [TechCrunch](https://techcrunch.com/2024/10/24/bluesky-raises-15m-series-a-plans-to-launch-subscriptions/)

## How Many Employees Work at Bluesky?

Bluesky has **20 full-time employees and 100 contractors** who work as content moderators. Bluesky operates with a fully remote team.

At the time of writing, Bluesky had 2 publicly available job postings on its website.

**Source:** [Bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/jay.bsky.team/post/3lbd2ee2pwc2r), [Platformer](https://www.platformer.news/bluesky-growth-content-moderation-trust-safety-interview/)

## Conclusion

That’s it for my list of Bluesky user stats.

Bluesky is currently one of the fastest-growing social networks but as a private company they don’t disclose many details. So I did my best to find recent data from multiple sources to bring you the latest stats on one page."}

title: Bluesky Social Statistics 2025: User Growth & Demographics Report
author: Keith Kakadia
url: https://sociallyin.com/resources/bluesky-statistics/
hostname: sociallyin.com
description: Explore comprehensive Bluesky Social statistics, from its surge to 27.4M users to detailed demographics. Analysis of growth trends, user behavior, and platform engagement in 2025.
sitename: Sociallyin
date: 2025-02-05
---
**Table of Contents:**

-
[Bluesky Social’s Explosive User Growth in Late 2024 and Early 2025](https://sociallyin.com#Bluesky_Socials_Explosive_User_Growth_in_Late_2024_and_Early_2025) -
[Website Traffic and App Download Trends: A Reflection of User Growth](https://sociallyin.com#Website_Traffic_and_App_Download_Trends_A_Reflection_of_User_Growth) -
[Understanding the Bluesky User Base: Demographics and Geographic Distribution](https://sociallyin.com#Understanding_the_Bluesky_User_Base_Demographics_and_Geographic_Distribution) -
[Influence and Engagement: Analyzing the Most Followed and Most Blocked Accounts](https://sociallyin.com#Influence_and_Engagement_Analyzing_the_Most_Followed_and_Most_Blocked_Accounts) -
[Behind the Scenes: Bluesky’s Company Structure, Funding, and Operations](https://sociallyin.com#Behind_the_Scenes_Blueskys_Company_Structure_Funding_and_Operations) -
[Frequently Asked Questions](https://sociallyin.com#Frequently_Asked_Questions)-
[How many people use Bluesky daily compared to monthly?](https://sociallyin.com#How_many_people_use_Bluesky_daily_compared_to_monthly) -
[What is the most popular age group on Bluesky?](https://sociallyin.com#What_is_the_most_popular_age_group_on_Bluesky) -
[What are the top 5 countries with the most Bluesky users?](https://sociallyin.com#What_are_the_top_5_countries_with_the_most_Bluesky_users) -
[Who are the top 5 most followed accounts on Bluesky?](https://sociallyin.com#Who_are_the_top_5_most_followed_accounts_on_Bluesky) -
[Who are the top 5 most blocked accounts on Bluesky?](https://sociallyin.com#Who_are_the_top_5_most_blocked_accounts_on_Bluesky) -
[How much funding has Bluesky received, and what are their primary funding sources?](https://sociallyin.com#How_much_funding_has_Bluesky_received_and_what_are_their_primary_funding_sources) -
[What is Bluesky’s growth rate, and how does it compare to other social media platforms?](https://sociallyin.com#What_is_Blueskys_growth_rate_and_how_does_it_compare_to_other_social_media_platforms)

-
-
[Conclusion](https://sociallyin.com#Conclusion) -
[Reference](https://sociallyin.com#Reference)

In the rapidly evolving social media environment, Bluesky Social has emerged as a compelling case study in exponential platform development. Recent data from Backlinko reveals a remarkable surge in user adoption, with the platform’s user base expanding from 10 million in September 2024 to 27.44 million by mid-January 2025.

The platform’s distinctive decentralized architecture has attracted a demographically diverse audience, though SimilarWeb data indicates a clear skew toward younger users, with over 62% of participants under age 35. This youth-driven momentum has contributed to unprecedented engagement metrics, including 154.68 million website visits in December 2024 alone, according to Semrush analytics.

What makes Bluesky’s trajectory particularly noteworthy is its sustained growth rate of approximately 0.5 users per second, as reported by Exploding Topics. This acceleration has caught the attention of influential figures across entertainment, politics, and media, with personalities like Mark Cuban and Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez amassing followings exceeding 1 million users each.

Behind these numbers lies a lean operational model that challenges traditional social media infrastructure. With just 20 full-time employees supported by 100 contractors, Bluesky has secured $23 million in funding while maintaining a fully remote workforce – suggesting a new blueprint for scaling social platforms in the post-pandemic era.

## Bluesky Social’s Explosive User Growth in Late 2024 and Early 2025

Backlinko’s thorough tracking reveals an unprecedented growth trajectory for Bluesky Social between September 2024 and January 2025. The platform’s user base expanded by 174.4% in just four months, demonstrating one of the fastest adoption rates among emerging social networks in recent years.

### Documenting the Surge: User Numbers from September 2024 to January 2025

The platform’s growth curve shows distinct acceleration phases throughout late 2024. Starting from 10 million users on September 15, Bluesky doubled its user base to 20 million by November 20, representing an average daily gain of 166,667 new users during this period.

The momentum continued through December 19, when the platform reached 25.9 million users, before climbing to 27.44 million by January 14, 2025.

#### Quantifying the Growth Rate: 0.5 Users Per Second

Exploding Topics’ analysis indicates a consistent growth rate of approximately 0.5 users per second throughout this period. This translates to 43,200 new users daily, suggesting robust platform scalability despite the rapid expansion.

The sustained growth rate particularly stands out during the September-December surge, when the platform maintained stable performance while processing an average of 1,800 new user registrations per hour.

### Projecting the Future: 30 Million Users by April 2025

Based on current growth patterns, Exploding Topics projects Bluesky Social will reach 30 million users by April 2025. This forecast accounts for the platform’s demonstrated ability to maintain a steady growth rate of 0.5 users per second, even during periods of intense scaling.

The projection appears conservative when compared to the platform’s historical performance, considering it added 15.9 million users in the 95 days between September and December 2024, averaging 167,368 new users daily during peak growth phases.

## Website Traffic and App Download Trends: A Reflection of User Growth

Semrush analytics reveals a striking correlation between Bluesky Social’s website traffic and its exponential user growth in late 2024.

The platform’s digital footprint expanded dramatically, with website visits increasing nearly ninefold between June and December 2024, while app installations reached record levels during the same period.

### Website Traffic Analysis: 154.68 Million Visits in December 2024

Semrush data documents an extraordinary surge in website traffic, with monthly visits climbing from 17.41 million in June 2024 to 154.68 million by December 2024. This 888% increase over six months represents one of the steepest growth curves observed in social media platforms during 2024.

The December peak coincided with the platform’s rapid user acquisition phase, when Bluesky was adding approximately 43,200 new users daily.

### App Download Surge: 7.85 Million Downloads in November 2024

According to Statista and Appfigures analytics, Bluesky’s mobile presence reached its zenith in November 2024, recording 7.85 million app downloads across both major mobile platforms.

This peak contributed significantly to the platform’s total 2024 installation base of 16.52 million downloads through November. The timing of this surge aligned precisely with the platform’s acceleration to 20 million users by November 20, 2024, as reported by Backlinko.

### Platform Preference: Android vs. iOS Downloads

A notable shift occurred between May and July 2024, when Android installations surpassed iOS downloads for the first time, according to Statista data.

This transition reflects Bluesky’s expanding global reach, particularly in markets where Android devices dominate mobile usage.

The platform preference data correlates strongly with Bluesky’s geographic distribution patterns, showing significant user growth in Android-heavy markets such as Brazil, where the platform captured 11.01% of its total user base.

## Understanding the Bluesky User Base: Demographics and Geographic Distribution

SimilarWeb’s thorough demographic analysis reveals distinct patterns in Bluesky Social’s user composition, painting a picture of a platform that particularly resonates with younger, tech-savvy audiences.

The data shows clear demographic concentrations that distinguish Bluesky from more established social networks.

### Age Demographics: A Young User Base

SimilarWeb data indicates a strong youth skew in Bluesky’s user demographics, with 35.02% of users falling within the 18-24 age bracket. The platform’s appeal to young adults extends further, as an additional 27.67% of users are aged 25-34.

This concentration of users under 35 (62.69%) suggests the platform has successfully tapped into digital natives’ preferences for decentralized social networking.

### Gender Breakdown: Male Dominance on the Platform

The platform exhibits a notable gender disparity, with SimilarWeb reporting that 62.04% of users identify as male, compared to 37.96% female.

This male-skewed ratio aligns with early adoption patterns typically seen in technology-focused platforms, particularly those emphasizing decentralized architecture and technical innovation.

### Geographic Analysis: The United States Leads, Followed by Brazil and the UK

Geographic distribution data reveals varying levels of market penetration across regions. Semrush analytics shows the United States leading with 55.7% of users, though SimilarWeb reports a more modest 42.27%.

Brazil has emerged as a significant market, capturing 11.01% of users, while the UK maintains a solid presence with 7.51% according to SimilarWeb (6.97% per Semrush). Japan follows with approximately 6.75% (Semrush), while Germany and Canada round out the top markets with 3.21% and 3.05% respectively.

### Daily Active Users in the US and UK

The Financial Times, as reported by Backlinko, identifies 3.5 million daily active users across the US and UK markets combined.

This engagement metric represents approximately 12.8% of Bluesky’s total user base converting to daily active users in these key markets, suggesting strong user retention and engagement patterns in English-speaking regions.

## Influence and Engagement: Analyzing the Most Followed and Most Blocked Accounts

The distribution of influence on Bluesky Social reveals distinct characteristics of user engagement and platform interactions.

Data from multiple tracking sources, including Bluesky Stats Online, Exploding Topics, and Blue Facts Dev, demonstrates a diverse ecosystem of influential accounts spanning entertainment, politics, and media sectors.

### Top Followed Accounts: Celebrities, Political Figures, and Media Organizations

Analysis of follower metrics shows significant variation across different tracking platforms. Blue Facts Dev data indicates strong performance among political figures, with Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez maintaining 1,731,865 followers, while Bluesky Stats Online reports entrepreneur Mark Cuban leading individual accounts with 1,250,242 followers.

The entertainment sector shows substantial influence, with George Takei and Mark Hamill each commanding over 1 million followers according to Blue Facts Dev (1,152,594 and 1,119,493 respectively).

#### The Official Bluesky Account: An Outlier in Follower Count

The platform’s official account demonstrates unprecedented reach, with Blue Facts Dev reporting 22,731,569 followers – nearly 13 times the following of the next most popular account. This significant disparity between the official account and individual influencers suggests a centralized communication model, where platform updates and announcements reach approximately 82.8% of the total user base.

### Most Blocked Users: A Diverse Range of Profiles

VQV App’s block tracking reveals complex community moderation patterns across the platform. The blocked user database spans multiple categories, including content creators, journalists, political commentators, and automated accounts, indicating diverse triggers for user blocking behavior.

#### High Block Counts: Tens of Thousands of Blocks for Some Accounts

Block metrics from VQV App show concentrated blocking activity, with the highest counts reaching 27,074 blocks for @eisinceraa.bsky.social and 24,019 for @dril.bsky.social.

These numbers represent significant community response, with the most-blocked accounts facing rejection from approximately 0.1% of the platform’s total user base.

The pattern suggests active community moderation through individual blocking decisions rather than centralized content restriction.

## Behind the Scenes: Bluesky’s Company Structure, Funding, and Operations

Backlinko’s analysis, drawing from TechCrunch, Bluesky, and Platformer reports, reveals Bluesky’s distinctive operational approach. The platform maintains remarkable efficiency with a lean organizational structure, having scaled to serve over 27 million users while operating with just 120 total team members.

### Team Structure: 20 Full-Time Employees and 100 Contractors

The platform operates with a primary team of 20 full-time employees, supplemented by 100 contractors primarily focused on content moderation. This 1:5 ratio of employees to contractors represents an innovative approach to scalability, allowing the platform to maintain agility while managing rapid user growth.

The model demonstrates particular efficiency in cost management, with each full-time employee effectively supporting approximately 1.37 million users.

### Funding Rounds: $23 Million Secured

Bluesky’s funding history shows strategic capital deployment across two major rounds. The initial $8 million Seed round in July 2023 established foundational infrastructure, while the subsequent $15 million Series A in October 2024 coincided with the platform’s exponential growth phase.

This funding trajectory translates to approximately $0.84 per user based on January 2025’s user count, suggesting efficient capital utilization compared to industry standards.

### Remote Work Model: A Fully Distributed Team

The platform’s fully remote operational model, documented by TechCrunch and verified by Platformer, demonstrates the viability of distributed teams in social media platform management.

This approach has enabled Bluesky to tap into global talent pools while maintaining operational costs at approximately 5% of its total funding, according to industry analysts. The remote structure particularly benefits the content moderation team, enabling 24/7 coverage across multiple time zones with the 100-person contractor workforce.

## Frequently Asked Questions

#### How many people use Bluesky daily compared to monthly?

According to the Financial Times via Backlinko, Bluesky records 3.5 million daily active users in the US and UK combined as of early 2025. This represents approximately 12.8% of the platform’s total monthly user base, which reached 27.44 million globally by January 14, 2025.

#### What is the most popular age group on Bluesky?

SimilarWeb data reveals that Gen Z and younger millennials dominate the platform, with 18-24 year-olds comprising 35.02% of users, followed by 25-34 year-olds at 27.67%.

This concentration of younger users indicates strong appeal among digital natives.

#### What are the top 5 countries with the most Bluesky users?

Geographic distribution data shows varying percentages across sources.

The United States leads with 42.27-55.7% of users (SimilarWeb/Semrush), followed by Brazil (11.01%), the UK (6.97-7.51%), Japan (6.18-6.75%), and Germany (3.21%). Canada maintains a notable presence with 3.05% of users.

#### Who are the top 5 most followed accounts on Bluesky?

The platform’s official account leads by a significant margin with 18-22.7 million followers (Exploding Topics/Blue Facts Dev).

Among individual users, Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez commands 1.18-1.73 million followers, followed by Mark Cuban (1.25 million), George Takei (0.93-1.15 million), and Mark Hamill (0.9-1.12 million).

#### Who are the top 5 most blocked accounts on Bluesky?

VQV App tracking reveals diverse profiles among frequently blocked accounts, with @eisinceraa.bsky.social leading at 27,074 blocks, followed by @dril.bsky.social at 24,019 blocks.

The blocked accounts span content creators, political figures, journalists, and automated accounts.

#### How much funding has Bluesky received, and what are their primary funding sources?

Bluesky has secured $23 million in total funding through two rounds: an $8 million Seed round in July 2023 and a $15 million Series A round in October 2024, as reported by TechCrunch, Bluesky, and Platformer via Backlinko.

Exploding Topics data shows Bluesky consistently adding approximately 0.5 users per second. The platform demonstrated remarkable momentum by more than doubling its user base from 10 million to 25.9 million between September and December 2024, representing one of the fastest growth rates among emerging social platforms.

## Conclusion

Bluesky Social’s meteoric rise in late 2024 demonstrates remarkable platform growth, with user numbers surging from 10 million in September 2024 to 27.44 million by January 2025, as documented by Backlinko. This 174.4% increase occurred alongside substantial engagement metrics, including 154.68 million monthly website visits and 7.85 million app downloads at their respective peaks.

The platform’s demographic composition reveals distinct patterns: SimilarWeb data shows 62.69% of users are under 35, with Gen Z (18-24) representing the largest cohort at 35.02%. The gender distribution skews male at 62.04%, while geographic data indicates strong U.S. dominance, though with notable variances between sources (42.27-55.7% of total users).

Bluesky’s operational model presents an intriguing case study in lean platform management. The company maintains efficiency with just 20 full-time employees and 100 contractors, while securing $23 million in funding across two rounds. This structure yields an impressive ratio of approximately 1.37 million users per full-time employee.

These metrics paint a picture of rapid growth and efficient scaling, though several challenges merit attention. Content moderation demands are evidenced by high block counts reaching 27,074 for single accounts, while data discrepancies between tracking sources suggest the need for standardized measurement protocols.

Future research should address current limitations in engagement metrics and demographic data to better understand user behavior patterns and platform sustainability.

As Bluesky approaches its projected 30 million users by April 2025, its trajectory indicates potential for significant market impact, provided it can maintain its growth momentum while addressing these operational challenges.

messages.content:
Based on the information gathered, here are the key points relevant to estimating the probability of Bluesky having fewer than 800,000 unique posters on March 30, 2025:

1. **User Growth**: Bluesky has experienced rapid growth, with its user base increasing from 13 million in late October 2024 to over 33 million by March 2025. This indicates a strong upward trend in user adoption.

2. **Posting Activity**: As of March 2025, there have been approximately 1.18 million posts made on Bluesky, which translates to an average of 35 posts per user. This suggests that a significant portion of the user base is actively posting.

3. **Engagement Levels**: The Bluesky website receives 196 million visits per month, with 41.3 million being unique visitors. This high level of engagement indicates that many users are actively interacting with the platform.

4. **Growth Rate**: The platform is gaining approximately 1 user per second, showing a continuous and strong growth trend.

Given these factors, the likelihood of Bluesky having fewer than 800,000 unique posters seems low. The rapid growth in user numbers and high engagement levels suggest that the number of unique posters is likely to be substantial.

FINAL PROBABILITY: 0.1
